name: Product Manager (IntelliJ IDEA)
description:
At JetBrains, we strive to help developers and development teams be more productive and creative and make the software development process a more enjoyable experience.

One of the things we’re working on in our IDEs is integration with development platforms like Space and GitHub. The essential parts of these integrations are set up around working with git, merge requests and code reviews in the comfort of your IDE.

We are currently looking for a Product Manager to join the team to work on the Space and GitHub integrations, versions control systems, and other aspects of teamwork and collaboration in IntelliJ IDEA.

In this role, you will:

  • Drive the product in the right direction. Help the team create and deliver the product vision that aligns with user needs and JetBrains' goals.

  • Manage the product roadmap and lifecycle. Help the team think long-term and prioritize its tasks. Represent the user and be their voice.

  • Work closely with product designers, developers, and QAs to deliver features users need.

  • Communicate with users who are software developers. Conduct interviews to collect feedback, and analyze it to identify problems and ways to address them in the product.

  • Collaborate across teams. You will work closely with the Space team as well as with the IDE teams at JetBrains to build a common vision.

  • Do market and competitive research and work with the data analysts on quantitative product research to make informed, data-driven decisions.

  • Define and measure the success of the changes, new features, and the whole area you're responsible for.

We expect that you:

  • Have at least three years of product management, engineering, design, or equivalent experience.

  • Have a technical education or software development experience.

  • Are familiar with modern software development practices.

  • Are comfortable working in a highly technical domain.

  • Are proficient in English.

  • Have strong spoken and written communication skills.

  • Know how to build relationships with development, marketing, and design teams, as well as with stakeholders.

  • Are both a strategist and action-oriented.
